title: Computer Architecture
description: Introduction to logic gates, computer arithmetic, instruction-set architecture, assembly programming, translation of high-level languages into assembly. Computer system organization: datapath and control, pipelining, memory hierarchies, I/O systems; measures of performance.
prerequisites: COMPSCI 1XC3  and 1DM3  and registration in any Computer Science program (see Department Note 3 in the course listing) or in the Minor in Computer Science.
schedule: Three lectures, one tutorial, (one hour); first term; may be offered also in the second term
courseText: Introduction to logic gates, computer arithmetic, instruction-set architecture, assembly programming, translation of high-level languages into assembly. Computer system organization: datapath and control, pipelining, memory hierarchies, I/O systems; measures of performance.
